channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Government rules out interim payouts for health staff owed due to payroll errors
item.description: The government has put the kibosh on hopes hospital workers owed three quarters of a billion dollars could get an interim payout early.

item.title: Auckland's public health service tried to avoid increasing Covid-19 contact tracing capacity
item.description: Auckland's public health service tried to get out of a huge increase in Covid-19 contact tracing requirements, saying they seemed unnecessary.

item.title: Backpackers urge for visa extensions as Covid-19 rages overseas: 'Why would I want to leave?'
item.description: French backpacker Marine Baiguerra is among more than 13,000 people who have signed a petition seeking a six-month extension to Working Holiday Visas.

item.title: Auckland economy: Crisis summit to work out Covid-19 recovery plan
item.description: Auckland business leaders and the city's economic development agency are holding a day-long summit to thrash out a Covid-19 economic recovery plan.

item.title: NZers killed in South Korea landslide were from same family
item.description: The three New Zealanders who died in a mudslide in South Korea were members of the same family.

item.title: Unemployment figures set to be revealed
item.description: Official data will reveal how badly the Covid-19 lockdown cut job numbers, with economists saying the wage subsidy programme will have cushioned the worst of the rise.

item.title: 'Hostile board' blamed for resignation of Canterbury health official
item.description: The resignation of the Canterbury District Health Board's top official is being labelled as a disaster for the region.

item.title: Homicide investigation launched after man dies in West Auckland
item.description: A homicide investigation has been launched after the death of a man at a rural property in West Auckland.

item.title: Project getting fresh produce to hungry families to end, despite demand
item.description: A government initiative to help fruit and vegetable growers while also feeding hungry whānau is coming to an end - but food banks say demand for the service is only growing.

item.title: Taranaki farmer fined $45k for damming stream beside National Park
item.description: A Taranaki farmer has been described as "highly reckless" and lambasted for killing fish and "destroying the ecosystem" of a stream on the boundary of Egmont National Park.

item.title: Mental health needs assessed at isolation entry - Bloomfield
item.description: Dr Ashley Bloomfield says if there are new cases of community transmission in New Zealand, the threshold to recommend lockdown restrictions will be low.

item.title: Appeal against council ban on Southern, Molyneux event begins
item.description: The men who fought Auckland Council over its ban of Lauren Southern and Stefan Molyneux should not have to pay nearly $47,000 in court costs, a laywer says.

item.title: Hundreds queue for Covid testing in Queenstown
item.description: At least 1000 people queued in Queenstown for a Covid-19 test after a recent visitor tested positive in South Korea.

item.title: Canterbury, West Coast DHB chief executive Meates' resignation a 'disaster' - ASMS
item.description: Canterbury and West Coast DHB chief executive David Meates has resigned. The senior doctors union says he was pushed out by a "hostile" board.

item.title: First large-scale food waste-to-bioenergy facility construction begins
item.description: Construction is beginning on New Zealand's first large-scale food waste-to-bioenergy facility at Reporoa, in the central North Island.

item.title: Union calls out health company restructure costing 100 jobs
item.description: A union claims a healthcare company has "rode roughshod" over its staff and community as it rolls out a new centralised health service centre.

item.title: Two people charged over death of Southland man Dale Watene
item.description: The police have charged and arrested two people over the death of Southland man Dale Watene.

item.title: Benjamin Swann retrial: Boys give statement accusing former teacher of abuse
item.description: The trial of a former school teacher accused of abusing teenage boys has now heard from three of the boys at the centre of the case.
